intro: Myrsine kimberleyensis, commonly known as Kimberley myrsine, is a flowering plant native to northern Australia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is a shrub characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are usually glossy and dark green. It produces small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by red, fleshy berries. The species is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient component of the local flora.
